Some conditions, such as 
haemophilia and muscular 
dystrophy, are only found in boys 
(although girls may carry the 
condition in their chromosomes 
and pass it on to their sons). 
Tell your midwife or doctor 
if these or other genetic 
conditions	run	in	your	family,	
as it may then be important to 
know your baby’s sex.
